com.karmant.syn

Class SynBinder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.karmant.syn.SynBinder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the class of the start nonterminal.

    public class SynBinder<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    Binder - an add-on to SynParser that maps nonterminals and grammar attributes to client-supplied Java classes and fields, correspondingly.

    Consider a fragment of a SYN grammar: 

     IfStatement
        :       "if" "(" condition=Expression ")" statement=Statement
                ("else" elseStatement=Statement)?
        ;
    and a Java class: 
     public class IfStatement {
        @SynField
        private Expression condition;
 
        @SynField
        private Statement statement;
 
        @SynField
        private Statement elseStatement;
 }
    SynBinder will map the IfStatement nonterminal to the Java class with the same name, mapping its attributes to corresponding class fields. The result of parsing will then be a tree consisting of client-supplied classes instead of less convenient SynNodes.

    See Also:
    SynField, SynInit

    • Constructor Detail

      • SynBinder

        public SynBinder(java.lang.Class<T> classToBind,
         java.io.Reader grammarReader)
          throws SynException
        Constructs a binder for the specified root class and the grammar provided via a reader.
        Parameters:
        classToBind - the class of the start nonterminal. There must be a nonterminal with the same name defined in the grammar. Classes for other nonterminals must be located in the same package as the passed class.
        grammarReader - the grammar reader.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of parameters is null.
        SynBinderException - if the grammar does not satisfy Binder limitations.
        SynException - if the grammar is invalid.

      • SynBinder

        public SynBinder(java.lang.Class<T> classToBind,
         java.io.Reader grammarReader,
         SourceDescriptor grammarDescriptor)
          throws SynException
        Constructs a binder for the specified root class and the grammar provided via a reader, specifying additionally the grammar source descriptor.
        Parameters:
        classToBind - the class of the start nonterminal.
        grammarReader - the grammar reader.
        grammarDescriptor - the grammar source descriptor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the class or the reader is null.
        SynBinderException - if the grammar does not satisfy Binder limitations.
        SynException - if the grammar is invalid.
        See Also:
        SynBinder(Class, Reader)

      • parse

        public T parse(java.io.Reader textReader)
        throws SynException
        Parses a text and maps it to Java objects of client-provided classes. The text is read from the specified Reader.
        Parameters:
        textReader - the text reader.
        Returns:
        the root node of the tree. Can be null, depending on the grammar.
        Throws:
        SynBinderException - if Java objects instantiation or initialization fails.
        SynException - if parsing fails.

      • parse

        public T parse(java.io.Reader textReader,
      SourceDescriptor textDescriptor)
        throws SynException
        Parses a text and maps it to Java objects of client-provided classes. The text is read from the specified Reader. Text source descriptor is specified.
        Parameters:
        textReader - the text reader.
        textDescriptor - the input descriptor.
        Returns:
        the root node of the tree. Can be null, depending on the grammar.
        Throws:
        SynBinderException - if Java objects instantiation or initialization fails.
        SynException - if parsing fails.
        See Also:
        parse(Reader)
